responses: Pulp Fiction is a 1994 crime film directed by Quentin Tarantino. It tells several stories of crime in Los Angeles that intertwine in non-linear order.

patterns: Is Shawshank Redemption a true story?
What is the plot of Shawshank Redemption?
responses: The Shawshank Redemption (1994) is based on a Stephen King novella. It stars Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman as two imprisoned men who bond over a number of years.

patterns: Who played the Joker in The Dark Knight?
Is The Dark Knight a Batman movie?
responses: The Dark Knight is a 2008 Batman film directed by Christopher Nolan. It features Heath Ledger's legendary, Oscar-winning performance as the Joker.

patterns: How long is the movie Titanic?
Did Jack really have to die in Titanic?
responses: Titanic (1997) is an epic romance directed by James Cameron. It stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet as members of different social classes who fall in love aboard the ill-fated ship.

patterns: Is The Matrix a sci-fi movie?
responses: The Matrix (1999) is a sci-fi action film where Keanu Reeves plays Neo, a computer hacker who learns that his reality is actually a simulated environment.

patterns: What is the famous quote from Forrest Gump?
responses: Forrest Gump (1994) stars Tom Hanks. It is famous for the line: 'Life is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're gonna get.'

patterns: What is the first rule of Fight Club?
responses: Fight Club (1999) stars Brad Pitt and Edward Norton. Its first rule is: 'You do not talk about Fight Club.' It explores themes of consumerism and masculinity.

patterns: What is the movie Seven about?

responses: Se7en (1995) is a dark thriller starring Brad Pitt and Morgan Freeman as detectives hunting a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motifs.

patterns: Is Silence of the Lambs scary?
responses: The Silence of the Lambs (1991) is a psychological thriller featuring Anthony Hopkins as the cannibalistic serial killer Dr. Hannibal Lecter.

patterns: Who stars in Saving Private Ryan?

patterns: Is Lion King a Disney movie?

patterns: What car is used in Back to the Future?

responses: Back to the Future (1985) stars Michael J. Fox as Marty McFly, who travels back to 1955 in a DeLorean time machine created by Doc Brown.

patterns: Is Terminator 2 better than the first?

patterns: What is the movie Alien about?
responses: Alien (1979) is a sci-fi horror film directed by Ridley Scott. It features Sigourney Weaver as Ripley, fighting a deadly extraterrestrial creature on a spaceship.

patterns: What is the shower scene in Psycho?
responses: Psycho (1960) is a horror masterpiece by Alfred Hitchcock, famous for its twist ending and the iconic shower scene featuring Norman Bates.

patterns: What is the movie Jaws about?
responses: Jaws (1975), directed by Steven Spielberg, is often considered the first summer blockbuster. It follows a hunt for a giant man-eating great white shark.

patterns: Are the dinosaurs real in Jurassic Park?
responses: Jurassic Park (1993) is a sci-fi adventure directed by Steven Spielberg about a theme park where dinosaurs have been brought back to life via cloning.

patterns: What are the blue people in Avatar called?

patterns: What is the plot of Joker?
responses: Joker (2019) is an origin story starring Joaquin Phoenix as Arthur Fleck, a failed clown who descends into insanity and becomes a criminal mastermind.
Oppenheimer (2023) is a biographical film directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Cillian Murphy as J. Robert Oppenheimer, the 'father of the atomic bomb.'

patterns: Who stars in the Barbie movie?
responses: Barbie (2023) is a fantasy comedy directed by Greta Gerwig, starring Margot Robbie as Barbie and Ryan Gosling as Ken.

patterns: What is Everything Everywhere All At Once?
responses: Everything Everywhere All at Once (2022) is a genre-bending multiverse film starring Michelle Yeoh. It won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

patterns: What is the movie Whiplash about?
responses: Whiplash (2014) is a drama about a young jazz drummer and his abusive instructor. It stars Miles Teller and J.K. Simmons.

patterns: Is La La Land a musical?

patterns: What is Mad Max: Fury Road?
responses: Mad Max: Fury Road (2015) is a high-octane action film directed by George Miller, starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron.

patterns: Who directed The Grand Budapest Hotel?

Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind (2004) stars Jim Carrey and Kate Winslet as a couple who undergo a procedure to erase each other from their memories.

patterns: Who directed No Country for Old Men?

patterns: Who stars in Wolf of Wall Street?

patterns: What is the movie Arrival about?

patterns: What is the movie Coco about?

patterns: What is the movie Up about?

patterns: What is the movie WALL-E about?
responses: WALL-E (2008) is a Pixar film about a lonely trash-compacting robot on a deserted Earth who falls in love with a probe named EVE.

Shrek (2001) is an animated comedy about an ogre who goes on a quest to rescue a princess. It was voiced by Mike Myers and Eddie Murphy.

patterns: What was the first CGI movie?

Parasite (2019) is a South Korean masterpiece that explores class discrimination through a dark and suspenseful story.

patterns: Who directed Raiders of the Lost Ark?

patterns: Is Schindler's List a true story?
responses: Schindler's List (1993) is a historical drama directed by Steven Spielberg. It tells the true story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman who saved the lives of more than a thousand Jewish refugees during the Holocaust.
The Prestige (2006) follows two rival stage magicians in 19th-century London who engage in a competitive game of one-upmanship with tragic results. It stars Hugh Jackman and Christian Bale.

Rocky (1976) was written by and stars Sylvester Stallone. It tells the rags-to-riches story of Rocky Balboa, an uneducated, kind-hearted working-class Italian-American boxer.

patterns: Tell me about the movie Gladiator
responses: Maximus Decimus Meridius is the protagonist of Gladiator (2000), a Roman General who becomes a gladiator to avenge the murder of his family. The film was directed by Ridley Scott.

patterns: What is The Green Mile about?

responses: The Green Mile (1999) is based on a Stephen King novel. It stars Tom Hanks as a death row prison guard who discovers one of his inmates, John Coffey, has supernatural healing powers.

patterns: Tell me about the movie Fargo
responses: Fargo (1996) was directed by the Coen Brothers. Although the film claims to be a true story, it is actually fictional. It stars Frances McDormand as a pregnant police chief.

patterns: What is the movie Casablanca about?
responses: Casablanca (1942) is a classic romantic drama set during WWII. It stars Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman. A famous line is 'Here's looking at you, kid.'

Citizen Kane (1941) was directed by and stars Orson Welles. It is often cited as the greatest film ever made due to its innovative cinematography and storytelling. 'Rosebud' is the final word spoken by the protagonist.

patterns: What is The Truman Show about?

responses: The Truman Show (1998) stars Jim Carrey as a man who discovers his entire life is actually a reality TV show being broadcast to the world.

patterns: Who directed the original Blade Runner?
responses: Blade Runner (1982), directed by Ridley Scott, is a sci-fi classic. Replicants are bioengineered humanoids that protagonist Rick Deckard is tasked with 'retiring.'

patterns: Who stars in Little Miss Sunshine?

responses: Little Miss Sunshine (2006) is a tragicomedy road film about a dysfunctional family trekking across the country in a yellow VW bus to get their daughter to a beauty pageant.

patterns: Who is Frank in Donnie Darko?

responses: Donnie Darko (2001) is a cult classic psychological thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal. Frank is a mysterious figure in a rabbit suit who tells Donnie the world will end in 28 days.

patterns: Who are the characters in Reservoir Dogs?

responses: The Big Lebowski (1998) is a Coen Brothers cult comedy starring Jeff Bridges as 'The Dude,' an avid bowler who gets entangled in a kidnapping plot.

patterns: Who stars in Good Will Hunting?

patterns: Is it a Vietnam War movie?

responses: Apocalypse Now (1979) is a war epic directed by Francis Ford Coppola. It is loosely based on Joseph Conrad's novella 'Heart of Darkness.'

patterns: Is Raging Bull in black and white?
responses: Raging Bull (1980) is a biographical drama directed by Martin Scorsese. It stars Robert De Niro as boxer Jake LaMotta and was filmed entirely in black and white.

Amadeus (1984) is a fictionalized biography of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, told from the perspective of his rival, Antonio Salieri.

patterns: How long is Lawrence of Arabia?
responses: Lawrence of Arabia (1962) is a nearly four-hour historical epic directed by David Lean, starring Peter O'Toole as T.E. Lawrence.

responses: City of God (2002) is a Brazilian crime film set in the favelas of Rio de Janeiro. It is based on semi-autobiographical events.

responses: Die Hard (1988) stars Bruce Willis as John McClane. While it's an action movie, many debate whether its Christmas setting makes it a holiday film.

responses: Monty Python and the Holy Grail (1975) is a surreal British comedy that parodies the legend of King Arthur's quest for the Holy Grail.

patterns: What is the movie Spotlight about?

patterns: Is It's a Wonderful Life a Christmas movie?
